ORG Delegates of the Commission heard evidence from witnesses in the case in GPE DATE and in GPE DATE , in the presence of representatives from both sides who were able to cross - examine the witnesses . After evaluating the oral and documentary evidence , the ORG came to the following conclusions with regard to the facts :

a ) It was not possible to make a definite finding as to the date on which PERSON was arrested , although this clearly took place no later than DATE . He was released on DATE , therefore he was detained for DATE .
b ) On DATE he was admitted to hospital and was diagnosed with bilateral radial paralysis . He left hospital on DATE on his own initiative , without having been properly discharged .

c ) There was no evidence that he had suffered any disability prior to his arrest , nor any evidence of any untoward incident during DATE between his release from police custody and his admission to hospital .

d ) The Commission noted that the medical evidence indicated that the applicant ’s injuries could have had various causes , but one of these could have been the trauma suffered by a person who had been strung up by his arms . Moreover , radial paralysis affecting both arms was apparently not a common condition , although it was consistent with the form of ill - treatment known as " NORP hanging " .

e ) The delegates heard evidence from CARDINAL of the policemen who had interrogated PERSON and from the public prosecutor who saw him prior to his release ; both claimed that it was inconceivable that he could have been ill - treated in any way . The ORG found this evidence unconvincing , since it gave the impression that the CARDINAL public officers were not prepared even to consider the possibility of ill - treatment occurring at the hands of the police .
f ) The Government offered no alternative explanation for PERSON injuries .

g ) There was insufficient evidence to enable any conclusions to be drawn with regard to the applicant ’s other allegations of ill - treatment by electric shocks and beatings . However , it did seem clear that he had been detained in a small cell with CARDINAL other people , all of whom had had to share a single bed and blanket , and that he had been kept blindfolded during interrogation .

CARDINAL . LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE provides as follows :

" No criminal , financial or legal responsibility may be claimed against ORG or a NORP Governor within a state of emergency region in respect of their decisions or acts connected with the exercise of the powers entrusted to them by this decree , and no application shall be made to any judicial authority to this end . CARDINAL ) .
